intro: Schlechteranthus tetrasepalus, commonly known as the four-lobed bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has four sepals that are fused at the base, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
